alert.note: Alert for Morris; Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 15 at 5:58PM EDT until July 15 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT FOR WEST CENTRAL MORRIS...SOUTHWESTERN SUSSEX AND NORTHEASTERN WARREN COUNTIES... At 558 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Hackettstown, or 13 miles south of Newton, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Hopatcong, Hackettstown, Mount Arlington, Stanhope, Netcong, Chester, Andover, Great Meadows-Vienna, Allamuchy-Panther Valley, Greendell, Budd Lake, Beatyestown, Long Valley, Succasunna-Kenvil and Beattyestown. This includes Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 14 and 29. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
